bug.title: [en] Wrong tagging
bug.body: DT_VB_NN tags tell/NN in this incorrect text: > ... and Enron about the **tell** Joann we had incurred.

bug.title: [en] Wrong tagging NNJJ_NN_JJ
bug.body: NNJJ_NN_JJ tags 'other' as JJ in these incorrect sentences: > Some people say that he died of hunger, some **other** tell that he still wanders. > Some people say that he died of hunger, some **other** say that he still wanders.

bug.title: [en] Wrong disambiguation BE_VBGNN_VBG
bug.body: BE_VBGNN_VBG tags 'pleasing' as VBG, but it is an adjective. > LanguageTool is **pleasing** to use.

bug.title: [en] Wrong tagging BE_VBGNN_VBG
bug.body: BE_VBGNN_VBG tags the adjective/noun in a noun cluster as VBG only: > These are **hearing** aids. > They are **smelling** salts, don't you know? [This sentence is ambiguous. 'Smelling' could be VBG, depending on context.]

bug.body: Noted in regression 2020-08-13. SOME_NN_VBP[1] suggests 'webs': > We have confirmation via some **web** site that Tenacious D will be there. Also: > I have information from some **government** site about the proposed changes to the regulations. > She found the information on some **blog** page about cats.

bug.title: [en] False warning TOO_TO[2]

bug.title: [en] Wrong tagging VBN_VBD

Verbs 'let' and 'put' are tagged as VBN: - [x] If my thinking is wrong please **let** me know. - [x] If any of you feel that others should be present please **let** me know. - [x] If you no longer have DSL or Cable service or You do not have either please **let** us know. - [x] If you have time please **let** me know if you know of anything. - [x] ... if my strategic concept has merit please **let** me know. - [x] If there are none please **let** us know also and we will prepare the final document for execution. - [x] If this is true please **put** it on my schedule. bug.title: [en] False warnings caused by the change of POS for 'please'
bug.body: The correction of the POS for 'please' (https://github.com/languagetool-org/languagetool/commit/f05df00a9bd032438c590d3933684f294c7c18db) causes many false warnings. @tiff and I decided on this plan of action: - Keep RB for "please". - But: Temporarily remove it until we have fixed all regressions.

bug.title: [en] Wrong tagging E_NP_NN_VBP

bug.title: [en] False warnings in A_NNS
bug.body: Grammar rule A_NNS gives false warnings for these sentences: > In **a perfect world spreaders** don't exist. > In **a perfect world technicians** don this equipment. > In **a perfect world technicians** wear PPE. Initially, as an alternative to adding antipatterns to the grammar rule, make disambiguation rules from the AP that I added to JJ_NN_JJ and NNJJ_NN_JJ for #3101. If the removal of JJ from 'world' does not fix the errors, then also add AP to A_NNS.

bug.title: [en] multiwords.txt does not work correctly
bug.body: Portuguese has the expected POS: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5816160/84131752-e1b95280-aa3c-11ea-9288-1fa990da4946.png) I added this line to the English multiwords.txt: `Fat CatNNPxy` English does not have the expected POS: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5816160/84132010-41aff900-aa3d-11ea-969a-c324925f1028.png) The problem is not merely a display error as suggested in https://forum.languagetool.org/t/en-multiwords-txt-for-english/5047/2. This is my test rule: ``` <rule id="MULTIWORDS_TEST" name="Multiwords test"> <pattern> <token postag="NNPxy"/> <token postag="NNPxy"/> </pattern> <message>Found: '\1 \2'.</message> <example correction="">Did you know that the <marker>Fat Cat</marker> is a pub in Sheffield?</example> </rule> ``` The GUI does not find the text (refer to the screen shot above). Testrules gives this error message: ``` 3632 rules tested. Exception in thread "main" org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRuleTest$PatternRuleTestFailure: Test failure for rule MULTIWORDS_TEST[1] in file /org/languagetool/rules/en/grammar.xml: Did you know that the Fat Cat is a pub in Sheffield?" Errors expected: 1 Errors found : 0 Message: Found: '\1 \2'. Analyzed token readings: [/SENT_START*] Did[do/VBD*,O] [ /null*] you[you/PRP,B-NP-singular|E-NP-singular] [ /null*] know[know/NN,know/VB,know/VBP,B-VP] [ /null*] that[that/DT,that/RP,that/WDT,that/WP,B-PP] [ /null*] the[the/DT,B-NP-singular] [ /null*] Fat[fat/JJ,Fat Cat/<NNPxy>,I-NP-singular] [ /null*] Cat[Cat/NNP,cat/NN,cat/VB,cat/VBP,Fat Cat/</NNPxy>,E-NP-singular] [ /null*] is[be/VBZ,B-VP] [ /null*] a[a/DT,B-NP-singular] [ /null*] pub[pub/NN,E-NP-singular] [ /null*] in[in/IN,B-PP] [ /null*] Sheffield[Sheffield/NNP,B-NP-singular|E-NP-singular] ?[?/SENT_END*,?/PCT*,O] Matches: [] ```

bug.title: [en] Subordinating conjunctions tagged as coordinating conjunctions
bug.body: File `added.txt` contains these conjunctions that are tagged as coordinating conjunctions (CC), but which are subordinating conjunctions: `before, till, unless, until, when, while` I propose to remove the terms from `added.txt`. The removal will cause some grammar rules and one disambiguation rule to fail. Thus, I will need to make the rules know about the coordinating conjunctions. I can think of 2 ways: - Make an entity for subordinating conjuctions. - Add a new POS for subordinating conjunctions. Currently, subordinating conjunctions have the same POS (IN) as prepositions (refer to tagset.txt). Before I do anything, I want your opinions and suggestions. References: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conjunction_(grammar) https://www.chompchomp.com/terms/coordinatingconjunction.htm https://www.bbc.co.uk/bitesize/topics/zwwp8mn/articles/zqk37p3 https://www.grammarly.com/blog/coordinating-conjunctions/ https://www.grammarly.com/blog/subordinating-conjunctions/

bug.title: LibreOffice add-on: remote server doesn't work
bug.body: The public LT API server (https://languagetool.org/api) has a limit of - currently - 40 requests per minute. Thus, when using it with a text that's not quite short, the user gets: ![Bildschirmfoto von 2020-03-29 14-14-37](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/857004/77848829-d5f11a80-71c7-11ea-9eac-d3db385c8130.png) The user has no way to understand the actual cause, so I suggest removing the option that uses the public server. Using a private server is okay, as these can be configured without a limit.

bug.title: IndexOutOfBoundsException with LibreOffice add-on
bug.body: With this test document, I get an error: https://github.com/languagetool-org/languagetool/blob/master/languagetool-office-extension/src/test/resources/manual-testing.odt?raw=true ![Bildschirmfoto von 2020-03-23 13-44-17](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/857004/77318333-31756100-6d0d-11ea-8186-ffa9b2526580.png) My settings: ![Bildschirmfoto von 2020-03-23 13-47-56](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/857004/77318342-34705180-6d0d-11ea-9ab7-d1e7bae6f2a6.png) Using LibreOffice 6.3.4.2 under Ubuntu 18.04. I tried several times and it seems to be reproducible 100%. No editing is needed, the error occurs a few seconds after the document is opened. @FredKruse Is this easily fixable? As there are other issues, do you think we should postpone the release of LT 4.9?

And this LT 4.9-SNAPSHOT extension on LO 5.4 (Win 32-bit) works fine. ![](https://forum.languagetool.org/uploads/db7402/original/2X/4/4c86aa64cf7770e6bd1f6e762fc535ec7ce43ebb.jpeg)

bug.title: [en] Wrong tagging: DT_JJ_NN_NN
bug.body: Noted whilst working on https://github.com/languagetooler-gmbh/languagetool-premium/issues/802. 'Form' is incorrectly tagged as NN:UN: > ... regional units, out of which the first four **form** 'Greater Athens', while the Piraeus...

bug.title: pattern using min=0 fails
bug.body: The pattern below fails. ``` <rule id="ERROR_DEMO1" name="" default="off"> <pattern> <token>Wat</token> <token min="0">niet</token> <token postag_regexp="yes" postag="WKW:(VLT|TGW):1EP"/> <token postag="SENT_END"/> </pattern> <message>demo error</message> <example type="incorrect"><marker>Wat niet wist.</marker></example> </rule> ```

bug.title: [en] Testrules does not find an incorrect rule
bug.body: This is my test rule: ``` <rule id="TEST" name="test"> <pattern> <token case_sensitive="yes">I</token> <token>am</token> <marker> <token>happy</token> </marker> </pattern> <message>My marker test</message> <example type="incorrect">I <marker>am sad</marker>.</example> </rule> ``` This is the testrules result: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5816160/75881182-7c8b0b00-5e16-11ea-8d74-72631d4d71ce.png) I am now going to re-boot and then try testruls again.

bug.title: Disambiguation combination bugs (?)
bug.body: Martin is a first as well as a last name, and is tagged as such. ENM:PER:FST and ENM:PER:LST: When I use disambiguation to add the more general flag for 'part of name', matching these tags with 'ENM:PER.*', the results in the disambig log contain Martin/NAME_PART twice. I think the root-flex-tag combinations should be kept unique. (Bug 1...) The antipatterns used in the grammar file rule matching this NAME_PART tag does not see this tag when it is there twice: Bug 2 When I add an exception to the disambiguation rule that prevents the creation of the double postag, the NAME_PART is correctly matched in the antipattern rule. So there is a (partial) workaround. By the way... only an exception prevents adding the double postag. An antipattern in the disambiguator does not prevent it. Which is also weird. Bug 3?

bug.title: [en] wrong tagging E_NP_NN_VBP
bug.body: The problem moves here after fixing #2526. Tagged only as nouns: > The poor drink to **drown** their sorrows. > ... and usually, the sick **hope** to become well.

bug.title: [en] wrong tagging DT_JJ_NN_NN
bug.body: Wrong tagging here after fixing #2519. Tagged only as nouns: > The angry **know** it all > The poor **drink** to drown their sorrows. > ... and usually, the sick **hope** to become well.

bug.title: Google Docs page index table error
bug.body: The whitespace between word and page number is ignored: ![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8479998/74718562-c37fda80-5232-11ea-81a9-421bc484fd61.png)

bug.title: Page change bug on Google Docs
bug.body: When a flowing sentence is broken by a soft page break, this page break is interpreted as a sentence ending, which is incorrect. A Dutch rule signals unexpected sentence end then. ![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8479998/74717548-e14c4000-5230-11ea-8729-1db1d9a816f9.png)

bug.title: another bullet list issue on Google Docs
bug.body: ![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8479998/74716263-7bf74f80-522e-11ea-9b64-7995dd62d1ef.png) The indent is not seen as whitespace.

bug.title: bullet list issue on Google Docs
bug.body: ![afbeelding](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8479998/74712933-cd501080-5227-11ea-9b28-ba846655c555.png) When the dash is at the start of the line, the first word is reported as a spelling error (internally seen as -word); when there is a space before it, it is not. This does not happen for English, so it could be related to the code that was added to allow for optional dashes in a Dutch word, which is in the disambiguation java code

bug.body: 'Help you to do' is correct grammar: These sentences will help you to find patterns for the rule. ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5816160/66662542-ef65d080-ec40-11e9-8f09-a44f94b3f7c3.png)

bug.body: > Dat is afhankelijk van uw situatie

bug.title: [en] false alarm RELATIVE_CLAUSE_AGREEMENT?
bug.body: > Tom is one of those rare individuals who has had a clear idea of his career path since he was a teenager.

bug.title: [en] Unknown word 'spiers' causes a spelling error for 'sharp spiers'
bug.body: The word 'spiers' is not known in LT. (The word is American English: www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/spier). The word causes a spelling error for the previous word if the previous word is on the same line or the immediate next line: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5816160/66320287-7865ca80-e916-11e9-86e8-2e6f0c6fcba4.png) I *think* that the problem is only with 'sharp spiers'. With 'These sharpened spiers are ...', there is no spelling error for 'sharpened'.

bug.title: PlainEnglish category creation issue
bug.body: @danielnaber At the moment it is impossible to create new Java categories. While trying to fit the new PlainEnglish java rule in the existing PLAIN_ENGLISH XML category, I had to create a new category in Categories.java. Although the Category was created and is in use, the rule is still grouped in the English Style category. The working code looks like this: ` public static final Categories PLAIN_ENGLISH = make("PLAIN_ENGLISH", "category_style");` but it should look like this: ` public static final Categories PLAIN_ENGLISH = make("PLAIN_ENGLISH", "category_plain_english");` This is not possible since [what I believe to be] a closed-source module blocks new category creation, and while compiling this error warning is shown: ``` `[INFO] ------------------------------------------------------- [INFO] T E S T S [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------- [INFO] Running org.languagetool.rules.en.MorfologikCanadianSpellerRuleTest SLF4J: Failed to load class "org.slf4j.impl.StaticLoggerBinder". bug.title: [en] False positives in MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_GB
bug.body: 'Man' and 'mar' are verbs. MORFOLOGIK_RULE_EN_GB gives warnings for these correct texts: When he mans the equipment, the technician must... ... if it mars the appearance.

bug.title: [en] Daily no longer works with British in LibreOffice
bug.body: Hello! I have gone to LibreOffice 6.3.1.2 and selected: Language → All Text → English (UK) It no longer analyses the text. For example: “This is is is is bad.” doesn't trigger anything. However, if we are writing with the text in Portuguese, grammar checking works.

bug.title: Language tool adds canvas tag to MS SharePoint wiki pages
bug.body: If you edit a SharePoint wiki page using Firefox browser with Language Tool addon following tag is saved to the wiki page html `<canvas class="lt-highlighter__canvas" width="1592" height="283" style="margin-top: 0px !important; margin-left: 0px !important;"></canvas>` This should not be part of the saved wiki, it causes the resulting wiki page to start with a huge empty header

bug.title: [en] one of the most + NN
bug.body: Not found: Barbecue Chicken Sandwich is one of the most frequently ordered meal. Should be 'meals'.

bug.title: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException crash with soft hypen
bug.body: See this in `MorfologikAmericanSpellerRuleTest`: ``` @Test public void testBug() throws IOException { lt.check("sus\u00AD tainability"); } ``` crashes with: ``` Caused by: java.lang.StringIndexOutOfBoundsException: String index out of range: 17 at java.lang.String.substring(String.java:1963) at org.languagetool.JLanguageTool.adjustRuleMatchPos(JLanguageTool.java:897) at org.languagetool.JLanguageTool$TextCheckCallable.getOtherRuleMatches(JLanguageTool.java:1321) ``` Somehow caused by `ruleMatch.setOffsetPosition(ruleMatch.getFromPos(), ruleMatch.getToPos()+hiddenCharOffset);` in `MorfologikSpellerRule`. Seems https://github.com/languagetool-org/languagetool/commit/08e2ece63fd640e12e16bb344857abe6b3496bd3 and https://github.com/languagetool-org/languagetool/commit/0f85901b75ef64a66af0c44c05d630397b526c6e in combination cause this.

bug.title: [pt-br] suggestion for lower case "facebook"
bug.body: "Facebook" doesn't appear in the suggestions even though it is in the `spelling.txt`: Doesn't happen with pt-pt

bug.title: [es] single letters marked as mistake
bug.body: > Un B > 4 x 4 ![Bildschirmfoto 2019-07-17 um 16 59 01](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37363/61386258-43684f80-a8b4-11e9-8717-f433c50c4ce3.png) ![Bildschirmfoto 2019-07-17 um 17 00 47](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37363/61386364-73afee00-a8b4-11e9-9c8b-c5d2dd0f0f3a.png) @danielnaber Shall I just add the letters to the spelling.txt or is there a smarter way of solving this?

bug.title: [en] DT_NN_SENT_END incorrectly removes postag PCT
bug.body: Disambiguation rule DT_NN_SENT_END incorrectly removes postag PCT from the question mark in this sentence: > How about we do this work? (I don't know how to correct the disambiguation.)

bug.title: LO/OO: ParagraphHandling fails to run only the required rules
bug.body: Even with `ParagraphHandling.ONLYNONPARA` (as called from `org.languagetool.openoffice.SingleDocument#checkSentence`), almost all rules seem to run. `Mode` and `ParagraphHandling` seem to have overlapping meaning. `ONLYNONPARA` not properly working is a problem, as it probably makes the check slow in LO/OO. Proper solution: clean up `Mode` and `ParagraphHandling`. Potential fast fix/workaround: call `JLanguageTool.check()` with `JLanguageTool.Mode.TEXTLEVEL_ONLY` as ther last parameter when in `ONLYNONPARA` mode. Also see #194

bug.title: [en] suggestion for "Everytime" not helpful
bug.body: > Everytime you agree. ![Bildschirmfoto 2019-05-03 um 10 54 30](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37363/57127841-ea4b4e00-6d91-11e9-9b56-c85d2d20e173.png) Doesn't seem to happen when it's in the middle of a sentence: ![Bildschirmfoto 2019-05-03 um 10 55 23](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37363/57127893-0cdd6700-6d92-11e9-939d-c9d4ada1d4bc.png)

bug.title: LT crashes when a word with null POS is used in match element with postag_replace
bug.body: See #1503 for one example and a stack trace. Issue also described in #793.

bug.title: "Em Maláui África" makes LT crash
bug.body: ``` Exception in thread "main" java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not check sentence (language: Portuguese (Portugal)): 'Em Maláui África' at org.languagetool.MultiThreadedJLanguageTool.performCheck(MultiThreadedJLanguageTool.java:179) at org.languagetool.commandline.Main.runOnFile(Main.java:194) at org.languagetool.commandline.Main.main(Main.java:466) Caused by: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not check sentence (language: Portuguese (Portugal)): 'Em Maláui África' at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.get(ForkJoinTask.java:1006) at org.languagetool.MultiThreadedJLanguageTool.performCheck(MultiThreadedJLanguageTool.java:176) ... 9 more Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not check sentence (language: Portuguese (Portugal)): 'Em Maláui África' at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance0(Native Method) at sun.reflect.NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(NativeConstructorAccessorImpl.java:62) at sun.reflect.DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.newInstance(DelegatingConstructorAccessorImpl.java:45) at java.lang.reflect.Constructor.newInstance(Constructor.java:423) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.getThrowableException(ForkJoinTask.java:593) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.get(ForkJoinTask.java:1005) ... 10 more Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not check sentence (language: Portuguese (Portugal)): 'Em Maláui África' at org.languagetool.JLanguageTool$TextCheckCallable.getOtherRuleMatches(JLanguageTool.java:1298) at org.languagetool.JLanguageTool$TextCheckCallable.call(JLanguageTool.java:1189) at org.languagetool.JLanguageTool$TextCheckCallable.call(JLanguageTool.java:1152) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask$AdaptedCallable.exec(ForkJoinTask.java:1424) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask.doExec(ForkJoinTask.java:289) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool$WorkQueue.runTask(ForkJoinPool.java:1056) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinPool.runWorker(ForkJoinPool.java:1692) at java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinWorkerThread.run(ForkJoinWorkerThread.java:157) Caused by: java.lang.RuntimeException: Error analyzing sentence: '<S> Em[em/SPS00] Maláui[Maláui/null] África[África/NPFSG00,áfrica/NCFS000,</S><P/>]' at org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRule.match(PatternRule.java:239) at org.languagetool.JLanguageTool.checkAnalyzedSentence(JLanguageTool.java:814) at org.languagetool.JLanguageTool$TextCheckCallable.getOtherRuleMatches(JLanguageTool.java:1255) ... 7 more Caused by: java.util.regex.PatternSyntaxException: Unclosed group near index 6 DA0(.. ^ at java.util.regex.Pattern.error(Pattern.java:1955) at java.util.regex.Pattern.accept(Pattern.java:1813) at java.util.regex.Pattern.group0(Pattern.java:2908) at java.util.regex.Pattern.sequence(Pattern.java:2051) at java.util.regex.Pattern.expr(Pattern.java:1996) at java.util.regex.Pattern.compile(Pattern.java:1696) at java.util.regex.Pattern.<init>(Pattern.java:1351) at java.util.regex.Pattern.compile(Pattern.java:1028) at org.languagetool.synthesis.BaseSynthesizer.synthesize(BaseSynthesizer.java:124) at org.languagetool.rules.patterns.MatchState.toFinalString(MatchState.java:251) at org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRuleMatcher.concatMatches(PatternRuleMatcher.java:465) at org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRuleMatcher.formatMatches(PatternRuleMatcher.java:348) at org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRuleMatcher.createRuleMatch(PatternRuleMatcher.java:192) at org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRuleMatcher.match(PatternRuleMatcher.java:159) at org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRule.match(PatternRule.java:235) ... 9 more ``` It seems the issue is in `MatchState`: `targetPosTag = pPosRegexMatch.matcher(targetPosTag).replaceAll(posTagReplace);` `targetPosTag` here is the same as `pPosRegexMatch` because it still has its initial value, which makes the replacement useles. Quick fix: add `!posTags.isEmpty()` to the `if`. Maybe @TiagoSantos81 has an opinion about this? The rule causing this is `ARTICLES_PRECEDING_LOCATIONS`.

bug.title: Underline color: Java error if there is a colon in the category name
bug.body: Change a category name to include a colon: `<category id="TYPOS" name="Test: Possible Typo" type="misspelling">` Testrules give no warning. LT operates correctly. Change the colour for the category. No problem: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5816160/43956486-582a71e8-9c9c-11e8-9e09-8d7c8ac34046.png) Close LT standalone, start LT standalone. Get a Java error: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5816160/43955400-ecf069cc-9c97-11e8-9322-e450f77a6791.png) Although there is a Java error, testrules gives no warnings. I guess this problem has the same cause as #1022. @f-knorr , a comment in the fix (https://github.com/languagetool-org/languagetool/commit/b11e5a897101fb3950032794bff33e8830deb5ff) shows that a colon is used with the hex code for the color. If it is possible for a colon to be in a category name when the underline colors are set by the user, please could you change the code such that there is no Java error? Thanks. (If it is not possible for a colon to be in a category name when the underline colors are set by a user, testrules should give a warning to say "do not use a colon in a category name".)

bug.title: [de] compounds.txt not working as good as it should
bug.body: I've just noticed that compounds.txt doesn't work as good as it should. I am writing from a German perspective but this might be applicable to other languages too: German compounds that are written as a single word without hyphen (`Firstpartsecondpart`) are entered into the file as `Firstpart-secondpart+`. If a user now enters `Firstpart secondpart` into LanguageTool, he/she'll get the message that it should be written as one word. So far so good. But if you look at compounds that are built from two nouns, many Germans do write `Firstpart Secondpart` and this mistake is not registered by LanguageTool. As an example: Correct: Dopplereffekt Incorrect (detected): Doppler effekt Incorrect (not detected): Doppler Effekt I do understand that there are good reasons why the detection is case-sensitive. But maybe it can be tweaked in a way that it also works if the second part of the word is written with a capital letter.

bug.title: [de] no spelling suggestion for 'Postleidzahl'
bug.body: The German spell checker does not come up with any suggestions for 'Postleidzahl'. Looks like a bug IMO.

bug.title: PatternRules ignore postag in <match> when rule contains <or>
bug.body: When writing some new rules for English, I wrote the following rule: ``` <rule> <pattern> <or> <token postag="SENT_START"/> <token regexp="yes">what|which|who|whose|where|when|whether|how</token> </or> <token postag="DT"/> <token postag="NNS"><exception postag="NN|NN:.*" postag_regexp="yes"/></token> <marker> <token postag="VBZ"><exception>is</exception></token> </marker> </pattern> <message>You should probably use <suggestion><match no="4" postag="VBP"/></suggestion>.</message> <example correction="bark">The dogs <marker>barks</marker> loudly.</example> <example correction="bark">He asked whether the dogs <marker>barks</marker> loudly.</example> </rule> ``` The test for this rules fails because the insertion of an inflected matched token (`<match no="4" postag="VBP"/>`). The reason for this seems to be the `<or>` within the rule: The PatternRuleHandler seems to treat the iinflection correclty only for the first token in the or-group. (see `suggestionMatches.clear();` in PatternRuleHandler.java)

bug.title: all words misspelled with en-GB
bug.body: See http://forum.languagetool.org/t/en-gb-wrong-result/1230/ Text to test: eta_i This is a long test.

bug.title: 'Ignore All' changes settings permanently
bug.body: In LibreOffice, when a rule is ignored using the context menu option ‘Ignore All’, or, the same option inside the spell-checking dialog, it becomes disabled in the settings. Ignoring a rule should only last until document editing session is over. A rule should only be disabled manually in the ‘Options’ dialog. Settings are not reset upon updates or reinstalls, and this behavior has made me believe that settings were being disabled between releases. I noticed this possible bug from version 3.4 of LanguageTool until the last SNAPSHOT version, using LibreOffice 5.2.3.3, both in Linux Mint 18 x64 and in Windows 7 x64.

bug.title: ConcurrentModificationException in GenericUnpairedBracketsRule with MultiThreadedJLanguageTool
bug.body: I have a batch issue checker that uses LanguageTool in a parallel stream. When I used a single `MultiThreadedJLanguageTool` instance, I found that I could reliably get the exception included below. In this scenario, `check(String)` is being called ~10,000 times over ~10 seconds with all default rules for en-US enabled. I have an alternate implementation in which I use regular `JLanguageTool` wrapped in a `ThreadLocal`; it seems to be working well enough, so this is not an urgent issue for me. ``` 18796: Error: java.lang.RuntimeException: java.util.concurrent.ExecutionException: java.util.ConcurrentModificationException 18796: Error: at bug.title: [all] Problem with <url> tag in grammar.xml
bug.body: Problem with <url> tag in grammar.xml If I put URL to rule like "http://new.gramota.ru/spravka/punctum?layout=item&id=58_722", grammar.xml can not validated.

bug.title: Elapsed time for results in the GUI is much longer than the processing time
bug.body: In the GUI, when there are many errors in the text, the elapsed time to see the results can be many minutes, although the processing time is only a few seconds. ![elapsed-time-is-non-linear](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5816160/18225681/2ad0108c-71f0-11e6-9d42-6ebc7e564188.png) Daniel wrote, "so it's indeed just the JTextPane being slow" ([http://www.mail-archive.com/languagetool-devel@lists.sourceforge.net/msg05833.html]). @pminos, if possible, please could you correct this problem? Thanks.

bug.title: [all] Problem with case in Java compound rule
bug.body: Java compound rule always replace compounds with lowercase letter (except first letter), even if compound.txt file contained the word in camel case. For example "Ростов-на-Дону" for Russian, Elektro-Gitarre, Elektro-Gitarren for German, etc. It should use case from compound.txt for all languages.

bug.title: Another problem with ruleEditor
bug.body: I can put ``` xml <rule id="testlj"> <pattern> <marker> <token postag="ADJ:.*" postag_regexp="yes"/> <token postag="NN:.*" postag_regexp="yes"/> </marker> <or> <token postag="NN:.*" postag_regexp="yes"/> <token postag="SENT_END" /> </or> </pattern> <message>test: </message> <!-- <example>Смелого пуля.</example> --> <example correction=""> <marker>хрестоматийное слово</marker>.</example> </rule> ``` into ruleEditor and ![screenshot from 2016-08-20 13-26-53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5239997/17830635/d28d8fba-66d9-11e6-9f66-a502c6792a9e.png) while there is only one `<rule>` block here...

bug.title: Some weird behavior of ruleEditor
bug.body: Using rule editor at http://community.languagetool.org/ruleEditor/expert with a rule ``` xml <rule id="Unify_Adj_NN_case"> <antipattern> <!-- begin problematic antipattern --> <token postag="ADJ:.*:T" postag_regexp='yes'> <exception postag="ADJ:.*:T" postag_regexp='yes' negate_pos='yes'/> </token> <marker> <token postag="NN.*:Nom" postag_regexp='yes' /> </marker> </antipattern> <!-- end problematic antipattern --> <pattern> <marker> <token postag="ADJ:.*" postag_regexp="yes"/> <token postag="NN:.*" postag_regexp="yes"/> </marker> </pattern> <message>test: </message> <example> <marker>хрестоматийными слова</marker> о природе </example> <example correction=""> <marker>хрестоматийное слово</marker></example> </rule> ``` shows an "Unexpected error in the example" ![screenshot from 2016-08-20 12-13-13](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5239997/17830254/7ee1b03a-66cf-11e6-9a3e-b036d17e1018.png) Changing any symbol in rule id fix this. (The present rule id seem to be the only one with antipattern, which is present in Russian grammar.xml at the moment.

bug.title: [de] Verb "pulen" causes false positive
bug.body: In the sentence "Er pulte das Etikett von der Flasche." the word "pulte" is incorrectly marked as an error. However, the list of recommendations contains "pulte" and its base form "pulen" is correctly recognized. Is there a "generic" fix?

bug.title: Bug on token with max and min values
bug.body: Hello, I recently found that my rule: ``` <rule id="IS_A_AN_PLURAL" name="IS_A_AN_PLURAL"> <pattern> <token postag='VBZ'></token> <token regexp='yes' postag='DT' chunk='B-NP-plural'>a|an</token> <token min='0' max='3'></token> <marker> <token chunk='E-NP-plural'><exception postag='NN'></exception></token> </marker> </pattern> <message>Please check verb-subject agreement. Verb: "<match no="1"/>", subject: "<match no="4"/>"</message> <example correction=''>L is an extreme <marker>points</marker>.</example> <example>L is an extreme point.</example> </rule> ``` doesn't match because of `<token min='0' max='3'></token>`. When i replace this with `<token></token>` it works. http://forum.languagetool.org/t/help-on-rule-with-optional-token/841

bug.title: testrules.bat error, LanguageTool-20160408-snapshot
bug.body: LanguageTool-20160408-snapshot introduced a problem with testrules: ``` D:\LanguageTool-3.4-SNAPSHOT>testrules en Error: Could not find or load main class org.languagetool.rules.patterns.PatternRuleTest Error: Could not find or load main class org.languagetool.tagging.disambiguation.rules.DisambiguationRuleTest Error: Could not find or load main class org.languagetool.rules.bitext.BitextPatternRuleTest Error: Could not find or load main class org.languagetool.ValidateFalseFriendsXmlTest ``` The error is in LanguageTool-20160413-snapshot.zip. I did not check other snapshots between the 2 dates.

bug.title: text in suggestion is ignored when match and regexp is used.
bug.body: Hello, I discovered what seems to be a bug. I need to catch some incorrect constructions like "nel vola-t i nén" and suggest the proper "vo nel la-t i nén". For detecting the wrong construct I use a <regexp>[Nn](' el|el|i l') ((ri?|)vo?(la|ci|cial|chal))(-t i|-t ele|) nén</regexp> Now, if I just use a suggestion with a text with \1 \2 etc, it works correctly; but in some case, I would need to do an extra transformation. When the matching is done with "token", then I can have a suggestion with text, and "match" with regexp_replace in it; it works correctly. But if I try that when the match is done with "regexp", then everything inside the "suggestion" but outside the "match" is ignored. Here are some test rules to reproduce it. ``` <rulegroup id="TESTS" name="Rîles di saye"> <rule id="TEST_01" name="xnel vola -> vo nel la"> <regexp>[Xx][Nn](' el|el|i l') ((ri?|)vo?(la|ci|cial|chal))(-t i|-t ele|) nén</regexp> <message>Test 01: <suggestion>vo <match no="1" regexp_match="[Xx].* (ri?|)vo?(la|ci|cial|chal)(-t i|-t ele|) nén" regexp_replace="nel $1$2$3 nén"/></suggestion>.</message> <example correction="foo nel la-t i nén"><marker>xnel vola-t i nén</marker> co.</example> </rule> <rule id="TEST_03" name="znel vola -> vo nel la"> <pattern> <token regexp="yes">znel</token> <token regexp="yes">(ri?|)vo?(la|ci|cial|chal)</token> </pattern> <message>Test 03: <suggestion>vo <match no="1" case_conversion="startlower" regexp_match="[zZ](nel)" regexp_replace="$1"></match> <match no="2" regexp_match="(ri?|)vo?(la|ci|cial|chal)" regexp_replace="$1$2"></match></suggestion>?</message> <example correction="vo nel rila"><marker>znel rvola</marker>-t i nén co.</example> </rule> </rulegroup> ``` rule 01 catches correctly "Xnel vola nén" but suggest "nel la nén" (the leading "Vo " disappears, and capitalization is wrong ). rule 03 catches correctly "'(Znel vola) nén" and correclty suggest "Vo nel la nén" (the problem is that I will need between 2 and 4 rules using <token> to catch the same complex patter as a single <regexp>, due to the apostrophes; that was the reason I looked at a rule with <regexp> to make it simple). Anyway, we can see the behaviour of the <suggestion> part is inconsistent, in test 01 the "vo " part is ignored, in test 02 it properly displays.

bug.title: rule with <regexp> not last causes duplicate ID problem during validation
bug.body: The rule that has no ID but contains `<regexp>` within a rulegroup causes validation to fail with the message that ID has already been used. To replicate: 1. Find DATA_NIEMOZLIWA rulegroup in Polish grammar file. 2. Move the first rule to the end of the rulegroup.

bug.title: UPPERCASE_SENTENCE_START false positive for (sub)species abbreviations
bug.body: This is an issue in scientific texts using `spp.` (species pluralis) frequently. Example: > Mit Erde und Staub belastete Lebensmittel können Bacillus spp. tragen. It is a Java rule. Not sure how to add this as an exception.

bug.title: cross-paragraph rules don't always work with command-line version
bug.body: The error in this text (`Delfin` vs. `Delphin`) does not get detected when `Main.runOnFileLineByLine()` is used, but it works with `runOnFileInOneGo()`: ``` Ein Test mit Delphin. Ein anderer Absatz. Hier noch ein Delfin. ``` ~~Part of the problem is that `JLanguageTool.getAllActiveRules()` calls `rule.reset()`, which isn't clean anyway.~~ Also see this thread: http://www.mail-archive.com/languagetool-devel@lists.sourceforge.net/msg04839.html

bug.title: unification bug
bug.body: This is easy to reproduce but not so easy fixable (for me), so I hope @milekpl can help with this: In German (latest source from git required) `Die alten Angst` gets unified, although it shouldn't. The problem seems to be that `getFinalUnificationValue()` returns true. Then, getUnifiedTokens() breaks and returns a "unification" where `alten` has been unified to a different token, namely `Angst`. This can be seens when turning on verbose mode.

bug.title: antipattern bug with skip
bug.body: I think there's a bug with antipattern: If it's used with skip, the immunization doesn't reach to the end of the pattern. For example, this rule matches `This is a simple sentence.` even though the antipattern should prevent that. With the `-v` option you can see that `sentence` doesn't get immunized. ``` <rule id="BUGGY" name="name"> <antipattern> <token skip="-1">a</token> <token>sentence</token> </antipattern> <pattern> <token>sentence</token> </pattern> <message>my message</message> <example type='incorrect'>This <marker>sentence</marker>.</example> <example type='correct'>This is a simple <marker>sentence</marker>.</example> </rule> ```

bug.title: Opening LT Options dialog box in LibO gives an error
bug.body: The latest nightly build gives an error for Tamil. It works fine in the version downloaded on 19 August. The attached image shows the error message. It also shows (in the right-hand side) a dialog box that opened using the earlier version. ![screenshot 2014-09-01 10 49 27](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1058549/4104205/34010a80-3183-11e4-8644-cb3fc0b77c08.png)

bug.title: "Ignore Once" doesn't work in LO/OO
bug.body: Call Tools -> LanguageTool -> Check Text with a text that contains errors detected by LT. Press "Ignore once" and the error will not be ignored, it will simply stay there. Tested with both LO 4.1 and OO 4.1. Happens only if AutospellCheck (i.e. the mode with the blue wavy underlines) is not activated. Very old reports about this: - https://issues.apache.org/ooo/show_bug.cgi?id=91668 - http://openoffice.2283327.n4.nabble.com/Proofreading-implementations-issues-td2792027.html Original report in our forum: http://languagetool-user-forum.2306527.n4.nabble.com/quot-Ignore-once-quot-in-OpenOffice-4-1-0-LanguageTool-2-6-td4641679.html

bug.title: GUI: enabling categories with default=off is buggy
bug.body: How to reproduce: - Switch to Spanish - Open the options dialog - Click on "Concordancia predicativa" to activate all rules in that categors - Close options dialog - Open options dialog again -> only the first rule in the "Concordancia predicativa" category is activated

bug.title: Bug: GenericUnpairedBracketsRule keeps references to objects
bug.body: Possible two different bugs. After checking a big corpus (~100000 documents) with the same instance of JLanguageTool, **org.languagetool.rules.Rule.previousMatches** and **org.languagetool.rules.Rule.removedMatches** contain thousand references to **RuleMatch** objects, slowing down LanguageTool. Seems like GenericUnpairedBracketsRule.reset() never calls Rule.clearMatches() so the Rule.previousMatches field keeps growing. Also, Rule.setAsDeleted() (called from GenericUnpairedBracketsRule) keeps adding references to org.languagetool.rules.Rule.removedMatches but there is no code to clear the list (e.g. on GenericUnpairedBracketsRule.reset()).

bug.title: GUI: wrong link in rule detail dialog
bug.body: - Start LT - Switch the language - Open Options - Use context menu to get rule details - Click "Rule details on community.languagetool.org" -> won't work, as the link still contains the original language, not the new one that has just been selected

bug.title: GUI: config changes don't become active immediately
bug.body: Probably introduced by #102: find an error in a text, open the configuration dialog, disable the check of that error. Result: the error is still marked. Expected result: the error disappears.

bug.title: Min/max causes a disambiguation action on the wrong token (LT 2.5)
bug.body: Testrules does not give a warning for the rule that follows. In the pattern, the marker is on the token 'technician', but in the second ambiguous example, the action is on the word 'the'. ``` <rule id="Min-max-disambiguation" name="Min/max disambiguation error"> <pattern> <token>but</token> <token min="0" max="1">if</token> <token>the</token> <marker> <token>technician</token> </marker> </pattern> <disambig action="add"><wd pos="MYPOS"/></disambig> <example type="untouched">... and the <marker>technician</marker> must do the test.</example> <example type="ambiguous" inputform="technician[technician/NN]" outputform="technician[technician/MYPOS,technician/NN]">... but if the <marker>technician</marker> does not ...</example> <example type="ambiguous" inputform="the[the/DT]" outputform="the[the/DT,the/MYPOS]">... but <marker>the</marker> technician opens the door...</example> ``` <!-- <example type="ambiguous" inputform="technician[technician/NN]" outputform="technician[technician/MYPOS,technician/NN]">... but the <marker>technician</marker> does not ...</example> --> ``` </rule> ``` And here is the output from the Tagger Result screen: <S> but[but/CC,but/NN,O] if[if/CC,if/NN,B-SBAR] the[the/DT,B-NP-singular] technician[technician/NN,technician/MYPOS,I-NP-singular] cannot[can/MD,E-NP-singular] …[</S>,O] <S> but[but/CC,but/NN,O] the[the/DT,the/MYPOS,B-NP-singular] technician[technician/NN,E-NP-singular] is[be/VBZ,B-VP] …[</S>,I-VP]

bug.title: inflected="yes" and unknown word
bug.body: There's a bug with our optimization when a we use `inflected="yes"` and a string like `synchron` (German) for which we don't know a lemma. Maybe this should just not be legal? The bug causes that errors are missed, but it doesn't occurr in the unit tests, as our optimization isn't active there. The situation in PatternRule.canBeIgnoredFor() is this: ``` inflectedRuleTokens = [synchron] sentence.getLemmaSet() = [der, prozeß, zeitlich, ab, ., laufen] ``` Thus `!inflectedRuleTokens.isEmpty() && !sentence.getLemmaSet().containsAll(inflectedRuleTokens)` evaluates to true and the rule is skipped when it shouldn't. To keep things simple for testing, one can use this rule (throw out all other rules): ``` <rule id="ZEITLICH_SYNCHRON" name="Verdoppelung: 'zeitlich synchron'"> <pattern> <token inflected="yes">synchron</token> </pattern> <message>bla</message> <example type="correct">Wir sollten das <marker>bla</marker> aufeinander abstimmen.</example> <example type="incorrect">Die Prozesse laufen zeitlich <marker>synchron</marker> ab.</example> </rule> ```

bug.title: Diacritics in URLs WikiCheck are incorrectly recognized
bug.body: For example, http://pl.wikipedia.org/wiki/%C5%9Awi%C4%99to is not found.

bug.title: add proper <token min="0"> support for disambiguation rules
bug.body: The code for <token min="0"/> is not complete in disambiguation rules, and they support this construct only partially. Bring PatternRule and DisambiguationRule in sync (move some methods from PatternRuleMatcher to AbstractPatternRulePerformer to use them in PatternRuleReplacer).

bug.title: stand-alone GUI: result of tagging removed by checking result
bug.body: Type some text and then immediately press Ctrl-T: the text will be tagged, but as the checking timer is still running, the tagging result will soon be overwritten by the text checking result.

bug.title: HTTPServerLoadTest hanging
bug.body: I just had another case of HTTPServerLoadTest hanging, like #13. Unfortunately I made a mistake so I don't have a stacktrace this time. I'm now running the test again for a longer time, hopefully I can reproduce the issue.
